newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest hogs seen steady after holiday - trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest hogs seen steady after holiday - trade.

text.p: Midwest cash hog prices Tuesday were seen mostly steady having already been priced into the market early Friday, livestock dealers said.
A surplus of hogs this week gave packers more than adequate live inventory to get started following the Labor Day holiday on Monday, dealers said.
One major packer was said to have bought hogs for delivery as far out as Thursday next week.
Iowa and Minnesota top prices for hogs delivered to the plant were seen at $56.50 per cwt while Illinois tops were pegged at $56.00 and Indiana/Ohio at $55.00-$55.50.
"I think we'll be steady after the holiday, until they (packers) see what happens with product prices," a southern Minnesota hog buyer said.

A seasonal increase in hog supplies this week, coupled with deteriorating demand for pork pulled direct cash hog prices down an average $3.00 to the lowest levels since mid- to- late June, according to market sources.
The cut-out value of U.S. Number two pork carcasses slid further Thursday to $74.78 per cwt, down $3.24 from last Friday.
